name: Beaches Turks & Caicos

reviews.title: Best Family Resort EVER - Even for Adults!
reviews.text: My husband and I returned from Beaches Turks and Caicos on December 8th after a 7 night stay. Since we traveled without children this trip and usually stay at high end adult only resorts, we were very apprehensive about the prospects of so many out of control kids taking over the property. I must say, we had nothing to worry about. Yes, there were lots of kids, but since they were constantly entertained ( plenty for them to do), they were "happy campers". We actually enjoyed watching them enjoy themselves. Also, the food and service was EXCELLENT. Cleanliness flawless. The resort has many nooks and crannies to get away from the kids and two fantastic restaurants, a great bar and hot tub just for adults only. We even found a few slot machines that actually were paying off. A woman next to me did win $1000.00!

As other reviews have said, the best place to stay is the Italian Village, but all the villages were just fine. And the beach was one of the best I've ever seen. We've stayed at Beaches Negril (which is also great), but Turks and Caicos exceeded our expectations. ALL the help were friendly and genuinely concerned that everyone was having a good time. Water park, lazy river florider all fun.
reviews.title: AWESOME FOR KIDS

reviews.text: We were wishing (almost) that we had brought some little ones with us! Bizarre as it sounds, we even had an Elmo tuck-in with photos to prove it. Very fun.
reviews.title: Love Love Love

reviews.text: Loved Turks and Caicos and will return.
reviews.title: Only woth the $ if you can drink your weight in wine on a daily basis.

reviews.text: This was our second Thanksgiving at Beaches and overall we loved it. We have two kids (7 and 3) and found the resort very kid friendly. First of all I would like to point out that my friends call me a vacation snob.
reviews.title: A great trip - great resort
Fun, relaxing vacation with teenagers
reviews.text: The Beach: Absolutely beautiful! White sand, warm water (in November!)
The Hotel Room: Average, but they had our roll-away there when we arrived, and it was clean. The housekeeping staff is friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Disregard the bad reviews!

likes.liked: — the beauty of the resort and the service

reviews.title: Too Expensive
reviews.text: The restaurants: All the buffets are just average, but the "sit down" menu service restaurants are quite nice. The two adults only restaurants are excellent! Don't get wine though, unless you spend money to buy a bottle, its terrible. The French coffee shop is also wonderful, with breakfast pastries, cereal and other goodies served all day. My teenage boys loved this place.

Activities/Recreation: We ended up disappointed because weather only allowed us to dive for a day and a half. Obviously not the fault of the resort. All the pool areas were beautiful and well maintained.
reviews.title: dont waste your time or money

likes.liked: — the beaches of Turks and Caicos

reviews.text: OVERALL: Gorgeous location, average room, above average restaurants, beautiful pools and beach, lots to do for all family members. It was very easy to allow our boys to do their own thing for large parts of the day as it felt safe in the resort, and we didn't have to give them any money to eat, or do anything. I really liked this aspect of the "all inclusive" concept. If you have younger kids, its probably an even better resort for you as they have babysitting and entertainment for the kids. Enjoy your visit.
reviews.title: We all had a great time

reviews.text: 4 star resort with 3 star food. great for kids of all ages. our son is 14 months old and had a blast. such a big place you'll never run out of places to explore
reviews.title: great entertainment, don't go for the food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading reviews about how this resort is kiddy land I wasn't exactly pumped about spending big money to stay at Beach's but a good friend was having a destination wedding there, so I didn't have much choice.
reviews.title: The most relaxing vacation I've ever had

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We're a couple in our early 30s (no kids) and we were pleasantly surprised. This was my first experience at an "all-inclusive" resort and I loved being able to pop into restaurants whenever we were hungry or thirsty. Better still we never had to carry money. This was convenient since we were in the water most of the time.
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Speaking of water, if you SCUBA (or want to try it)-- they money Beaches is the way to go. You can go on two boat dives a day to some really cool locations. All of these trips +tanks and gear (by choice we brought personal gear -mask, snorkel, and fins) are free for Beaches guests. One tip: as soon as you arrive, go out to the water sports booth and sign up for boat trips for the week--they fill up fast! I'm used to diving in California where the water is cold and the visibility leaves something to be desired. In Turks we had 75-100 ft visibility and we could dive sans wet suits!) If you don't SCUBA dive there are also snorkel boat trips (again---Beaches provides gear if you need it!).
reviews.title: this is paradise
trip report
reviews.text: As for food, the best dinner we had was at the Japanese restaurant. The fruit for the breakfast buffets was the most ripe and delicious I've ever eaten.

For us this was a shot in the dark - we did not know anyone who had been there but the TripAdvisor site had many many accolades - so we gave it a shot. We were not disappointed. It is a GREAT resort - all inclusive, including SCUBA diving which was important for our family. it has a wonderful water park that is great for adults, teens and kids. With 16 restaurants you will not lack for places to eat and most are very good.
reviews.title: Don't Wait Go Now!

reviews.text: Once you have book your trip - they take care of everything from that point out. They pick you up at the airport - your luggage is delivered directly to your room and leaving is done the same way - they pick up your luggage and delivery you to the airport in plenty of time for your flight.
reviews.title: Our family loved Beaches T&C and would go back in a flash!

reviews.text: SCUBA Diving - this may sound bizarre but we were lucky because they were having "bad" weather. OK, so their version of "bad" weather was that the winds were making the sea choppy in Grace Bay where they usually dive so they took us to the south side of the island by taxi and we boarded their boats that they moved there and took us to West Caicos - one of the top wall diving spots in the Caribbean. We found the wind to be very mild and extremely pleasant when we were on the beach but we were not complaining about them taking us to West Caicos!
reviews.title: Trip of a lifetime

reviews.text: One of our boy's girlfriends wanted to get PADI Certified so we enrolled her in a course right at the resort. Being Master SCUBA Divers, my wife and I monitored the class - it was nothing short of Excellent. Kabul who was the dive instructor did an excellent job of teaching and training her to relax and maintain neutral buoyancy. I would highly recommend the certification program at Beaches.
reviews.title: Best Vacation Ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bottomline - wonderful resort and a great vacation for all.
reviews.title: would not recommend if you do not have children

reviews.text: We stayed at Beaches Turks & Caicos the first week of December and were not disappointed. My husband, 3 year old and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay. I'll jump around a bit to try and cover everything. Airport transfer, incredibly easy and efficient. They huddle you outside, point you to a van, load your stuff, drive you there. No muss no fuss. We stayed in the French Pavilion, the lobby was gorgeous. In fact, the whole place is gorgeous and I think that's the thing that stuck with me the whole trip - the resort is immaculate. Clean, sparkling clean, everywhere you look. It looks like Disney (well the Disney I remember from the 90s). It has the otherworldly quality of beauty and lush flora. Really nice. We stayed in the French Pavilion in a ground floor walkout. While I know everyone raves about the Italian location, the French Pavilion was simply gorgeous. The room was spacious and clean, except for an ant problem which was restricted to the bathroom. I noticed it at first, and though, eh whatever. By day three, there was an army. And truth be told, we were too darn lazy to switch rooms and I thought for sure I would remember one day to ask housekeeping to do something. Lo and behold I came back one day and they were gone - every last ant was gone and none ever came back. That goes to show someone is paying attention and cares enough to do something about it, which I thought was wonderful. We had a king bed with a trundle bed couch which was great. Probably the thing I liked least, even more than the ants, were the snacks for SALE in the room. For an all inclusive resort this seems rather strange. Bottled water in your fridge is free, and is replenished daily which is great. There was no alcohol in the room, which would have been nice and I never did figure out if you could just get a bottle of wine somewhere and bring it back to the room. That is probably the biggest drawback of staying in the French Pavilion - I hear there were snacks and alcohol in other parts of the complex - but then again, was I willing to pay an extra $200+ per day for that, not really. The pool at the French Pavilion was wonderful and a special enclosed wading pool for little ones was my daughter's favorite spot the entire trip. The water in the wading pool was super warm, warmer than the big pool, but I found both to be the perfect temp for us. The pool is huge, relaxing and the bartending was terrific. I did not have one weak drink the entire time we were there. Which is saying a lot since I expected otherwise. In fact occasionally I had a drink that was too strong. Back to the room for a second, I loved our room, but am not sure a walkout was necessary. The pool is too far from the glass doors to feel like you could leave your room unlocked, so that's something to consider should you stay here. Poolside there were always an abundance of chairs and towels.
reviews.title: What a Lovely Place

reviews.text: The Sesame Street shows were great, my daughter loved them. There was a cute short parade one night in the Caribbean village that she liked. We did not use Camp Sesame b/c a) my daughter is extremely shy and b) she was sick and had a runny nose, which rightfully so they do not allow in Camp Sesame. The waterpark area was great, short slides off the pirate ship and here and there with padded landing areas for little ones. I thought it was heaven even though my daughter did not like the shooting water. There is also a flat area with more gentle water bubbling up and around for even the tiniest of tots - it's wonderful. The lazy river was great, and you could float around as often as you wanted. I saw kids doing the wave simulator thing and they seemed to be having a blast. There really seemed to be something for everyone, and I think Beaches went out of their way to provide a lot of diverse options for all ages in this area - it was well done.
reviews.title: Great place to take a family and friends.

reviews.text: The Beaches - skip Grace beach. We went there the first day, it was crowded, there was hardly any beach and it was difficult to find a chair. The Italian beach was a bit better - more width to the beach which was nice. But really, the best beach was Treasure Beach, down past the Caribbean Village - it was beautiful! Wide! Barely anyone was there! And yet it was still close enough to the Arizona restaurant to grab an open grilled burger or hot dog for lunch and have it on the beach with no problem. I wish we had found Treasure Beach on the first day instead of the last day. We spent the entire day on the beach. I went snorkeling in this area as well and there was only one other person in the water the whole time - LOVELY! The beach is as gorgeous as they say, beautiful white and the water, just out of a beautiful picture, you will love it!
reviews.title: paradise found

reviews.text: The food - generally speaking, better than I expected, but not 5 star. The simpler the item the better it was. Burgers at Bobby D's were very good. Pizza at DiNapolis very good. I also found it helpful that in some cases they told you how long it would take too cook. it at least helps you adjust what to do to entertain your tot while you wait. Ice cream is not real, which was a minor disappointment, but not a deal breaker. On the other hand, more extravagant dishes missed the mark. Rubbery swordfish and desserts that while artfully presented came straight from the refrigerator. Ribs at Arizona were very good, although nachos were not and we ate breakfast at Guiseppe's mostly and it was fine. We had dinner at Mario's one night, lasagne bolognese and that was fine. But I can forgive mediocre food with good drinks and a beautiful atmosphere and since there were plenty of both of those, we still remained in heaven. There are lovely little spots after dinner to relax in giant loungers and have drinks (right in front of Schooner's restaurant), and that was probably our favorite thing to do in the evening.
reviews.title: Great for a family with small children

reviews.text: My favorite meal had to be breakfast at Barefoot - steak and eggs on the beach, really good! We did not eat in any of the adult only restaurants so I can't vouch for their offerings.
reviews.title: Loved every minute of it - I'm done looking for another place to go

reviews.text: We traveled with our 2 little ones (2.5 yrs and 1 yr old) to Beaches in December. We had pretty low expectations given that it is a chain, and all inclusive.
reviews.title: Few Issues, but happy overall!

reviews.text: We booked the Italian Village Tuscan Suite. Our suite was nice due to its view - nice slice of the ocean, BUT beware, as the advertized kids room is actually the room you walk in to! There is no living area - you walk into the kids room and past that is the bedroom. The kids room was small - as we needed cribs for both kids (the lowest bunk bed is too high for our daughter as there are no rails) we could barely fit them together in the room.
reviews.title: Safest place ever and friendly, clean .

reviews.text: There is NO ROOM SERVICE! this was the first time we stayed in an all inclusive with no room service. Only the butler suites have room service, and we did not feel that the price for the upgrade was worth it.
reviews.title: So good, we're booked to go back next year

reviews.text: We atttended many of the Sesame Kids shows, and the kids absolutely loved them. The camp - we did not leave our kids there, but did see many parents dropping off their little ones. I saw some nannies who were caring, and some who couldn't care less - it was a mix.
reviews.title: Good, even with teenagers

reviews.text: The Italian Village had the best restaurants I felt, and even though everyone could eat at all restaurants, with small kids it is much easier to go right next to you. The menus in all restaurants don't change! That can get a bit tiring if you are not mixing up the restaurants. Our expectation of the food was pretty low, so we were not dissapointed much except for the kids options - the kids menus in all the restaurants inlcuded basically chicken nuggets, fries and pasta. Nothing healthy at all. We usually just tried to order whatever was somewhat more reasonable from the regular menu and had the kids split it.
reviews.title: Just Returned - Miss It Already!!

reviews.text: This was our second trip to Beaches in the Turks and Caicos and we had a great time. The Italian village has improved the facilities on offer, with an amazing pool, bar and restaurants. The facilities for children are some of the best I have ever experienced with candy floss on offer, a lazy river, water rides and a surf simulator to name a few. The staff were very friendly. The food was very good for an all-inclusive with plenty of choices. I would recommend the Barefoot restaurant in the Italian village. Only criticism is the beds. We have stayed in the French village and the Carribean village and the beds in both are no good. The mattresses are the wrong size for the beds and very hard. We had not have one comfortable night while we were there. Overal a brilliant place to go with children. The rest of the Island is also worth exploring. Hire a car as taxis can be very expensive. Some great jewellery shops on the island and I would recommend Royal Jewels.
reviews.title: Fantastic family hotel

reviews.text: This is the first review I have ever written. I am a parent of a two and five year old. This was the first vacation in the Caribbean where my wife and I enjoyed ourselves from start to finish (6 days) The children were entertained all the time. The pools are shallow, the water is warm, the food is spectacular, the rooms were big and air conditioned. The Sesame street characters are friendly and very approachable. The staff at the resort are friendly and most of all they are very kind to the children, which made me as a parent, very happy. When the children are happy, the parents are happy. I have been to 7 or more Caribbean resorts and this was nearly the best. Worth the money big time.
reviews.title: Parents with young children Paradise

reviews.text: There was nothing to not like. All the staff was attentive, friendly and ever ready to help. The manager (oral)at Mario's was very attentive and joyful person to speak to. We are vegetarian and Marlene ( Culinary concierge) in Caribbean village lobby made sure that whichever restaurant we go, we have special meals prepared for us. Usually people think around the world that vegetarians eat boiled vegetable, this was not the case here. They clearly understand the difference and knew what kind of food we were looking for. My 3 yr old enjoyed breakfast with characters, parade, dance party and water park. Beach was clean as it could be. Excellent amenities and we will surely go to beaches again.
reviews.title: Best Vacation we had ever

reviews.text: This was our fourth trip to Beaches Turks and Caicos and I have to say everytime we go back the quality is as good or better than the first time. The Resort is excellent but what makes it even more over the top is the employees. We see many of the same employees everytime we go and they make you feel like old friends you have known forever. With extra money so difficult to come up with these days the people here really make you feel the money you have spent was worth while. Thanks to all the employees who have made everyone of our trips special, especially Norbert in the Liquid Lounge!! We miss you guys and cant wait to see you next year!
reviews.title: Excellent as Usual!

reviews.text: Absolutely the best vacation! Something for everyone here. Traveled with my husband, three children 14,12, 10 and friends who had two children ages 8 and 6. The beach and pool areas are breathtaking. The food at all restaurants was delicious and had something for everyone. We have food allergies in our family and could not have felt more comfortable. The very first day the head chef sat down with me and explained how they deal with allergies. The staff went above and beyond. Night life was for the whole family, there is always something going on. The kids loved the xbox garage while the adults could go to the adult only restaurant. We snorkeled, parasailed, shopped, relaxed and can't wait to do it again!
reviews.title: Paradise
Bring your own Food!!
reviews.text: Let's get this straight from the get go. IF YOU DON"T HAVE KIDS, DO NOT GO.....This resort is fantastic for young ones, and they really have a great time - With the XBOX zone, and all the toys on the beach, along with the other perks - Kids really have a blast....I

Now - For people over the age of 15 - It's very challenging to find a meal that is anywhere approaching "good." We ate at all the "Adult Only" spots, and while the service is good, the food is just bland and frankly, awful.
reviews.title: Great time inspite of Beaches Resort
Beaches Resorts - only for Bums
reviews.text: Do the diving, snorkling, and all the day trips - Those are worth it, although most will cost you extra.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, a great time for the kids, Mom and Dad will struggle to find it a "great" place for them as well.
reviews.title: Adult Disney Land

likes.disliked: — Need to watch for the little people - but knew that going there

reviews.text: This is a copy of a letter I wrote. It was forwarded on to Beaches by my travel agent.
reviews.title: Had a great time

likes.liked: — clean, great ocean, very good service - spa was great tooo.

reviews.title: Great vacation for our family
reviews.text: My wife, 2 year-old son and I spent four nights here and had a wonderful time. Having stayed at a Sandals, we knew a little bit about what to expect so we weren't caught off guard like some of the other reviewers who expect the Ritz or Four Seasons.

reviews.title: Great Vacation
reviews.text: The room (in the French Village) was spacious and decently if not luxuriously furnished. The food was mediocre but we sort of knew what to expect. (Arizona's was nice in the evening)

reviews.title: Loved it
reviews.text: Unfortunately, we didn't get to have an adult dinner and you do need to be prepared for a schedule that closes certain restaurants on certain nights. They had a Carribbean feast one night but really didn't promote it. We wish we had gone to that rather than the usual buffet fare.

reviews.title: Very disappointing
reviews.text: The drinks here were better than I've ever had at an all inclusive (they make what you want and don't water it down).

reviews.title: A nice resort, without the extras
reviews.text: The beach was great and so were the pools. Turks is truly a spectacular setting and the resort is just a 10 minute ride from the airport.
We just spent a week at this resort Jan.6-13. Our group consisted of 4 adults and 4 kids ages 2-5.
reviews.title: What a trip!
Beaches Turks and Caicos--a five time winner
reviews.text: Let me just say that I don't know what these other people are complaining about! Do not worry about all of the negative postings. It doesn't sound like we went to the same place.
We went on our trip knowing that this is an all-inclusive resort and that you can't expect perfection. With that in mind we had a fabulous time at this resort and we can't wait to go back.
reviews.title: Loved Beaches Turks & Caicos

reviews.text: The facilities are fantastic. We all loved the pools and the beach - you could always find seats. Yes, the beach is narrow but this is not even remotely a problem. The sand is like icing sugar with no rocks or anything in it. It is heavenly! You can snorkel right off the beach. There is a protected reef about a 10 minute walk from the hotel swim area. We saw sea turtles, star fish, a stingray and tons of beautiful fish. The kids loved Pirates Island with the waterslide and kids swim-up bar, not to mention the self-serve soft ice cream at Bobby D's!
reviews.title: Not worth the money

reviews.text: As far as the food goes, we thought it was really good for an all-inclusive resort. Between all of us we have been to a number of 5 star resorts in Mexico, Cuba and Dominican Republic and the food was much better at Beaches. The buffets were fine. There was always fresh fruit and salad. We had a great experience at Kimonos - it was lots of fun and the food was really good. We also enjoyed the 2 adults-only restaurants. The nights that we went to the adults-only restaurants we fed the kids at Arizona's and sat and had a bottle of wine while they were eating. It was great! We also really liked the coffee shop where you could get decent coffee as well as pastries, muffins, cookies and crepes!
reviews.title: don't waste your money

likes.disliked: — the old furniture. musty and dirty

reviews.text: We spent 9 days at this resort in the Italian Village and were there for hurricane Thomas. On the plus side, the kids loved Camp Sesame and the facilities are great. The down side is that the food at the buffets was frequently room-temp. Our whole family got sick during the trip. (The nurses were quite nice)
reviews.title: Not sure if I would go back

reviews.text: The setting is just beautiful - the colors are like none I've ever seen. The resort itself was filled with staff that wanted nothing more than to please the guests. The resort has something for every age - little ones can enjoy the Sesame Street activities, tweens and teens have an X-box gaming area and a night club just for them. The resturants (16) have excellent food. Dinner is an event - do not plan on being in and out in a hurry. For little ones there are buffets so waiting is not an issue. There are lots of activities- or you can just just take in the beauty on the beach or pool side- you choose!
reviews.title: The best vacation we have ever taken - it was just glorious!

reviews.text: If you want to take an excursion - the Provo adventure (86.00 - US) is well worth it. The boat capt. we had - Pringles, was wonderful.
reviews.title: Great food, fun shows and most kid friendly vacation you can find

reviews.text: If there are any negatives - there are plenty of restrooms - but sometimes they are hard to locate. Also - dinner service begins at 6:00. If you are not there at 10 till 6 wait until 7:00 or so if you don't want to wait for a table.
reviews.title: A little overpriced!
Excellent trip for mom and dad, grandma and small kids
reviews.text: Our family had a wonderful trip to Beaches Turks and Caicos, staying in the French Village. With two young daughters (1 and 3), a lot of planning is normally needed with any outing. Beaches made it pretty easy to have a vacation both with or without planning. Sesame daycare was loaded with fun activities that the kids enjoyed. The food variety, quality and service was great, however dinner only started at 6 pm at most restaurants and it make it difficult to see the 6:30 pm Sesame street show. This was the only annoying thing about our trip was having to rush a nice dinner every night and then end up being late for Elmo performing.
We travelled a long way from the UK but this was so worth it and we're booked to go back next year. We've been to Negril but this tops it by a distance.
reviews.title: Can't Be Beat

reviews.text: Even through Hurricane Tomas, this place was tremendous.
reviews.title: if you had one place to go on vacation, this is the place

reviews.text: This place is so good. I cannot recommend enough.
reviews.title: Beyond Expectations

reviews.text: Food good, drinks unbelievable, pools great, staff entertaining.
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.text: Stayed in the Caribbean Village Caicos room. Right next to the Italian Village. Central to everything. Why pay anymore for butlers?! All the staff can't do enough to help you.
reviews.title: Definitely worth a visit.
